Alright, I'm looking at this JSON object about a theater play in French from the 17th century. The title is "Ariane, tragédie. Par T. Corneille," and it was published in 1672. So right off the bat, I know that's within the 17th century.

The context section has information about people and places mentioned frequently in the play. Under people, NERINE is mentioned a lot, but more importantly, ARIANE is listed twice in the top_5_persons. That makes me think of the mythological figure Ariane, who's associated with ancient Greece, specifically Crete.

Looking at the places, PARIS is the top location, and it also mentionsAthènes, which is Athens. So even though the play is French and set in Paris where it was published, the story seems to be set in Athens because of references to Ariane.

Given that Ariane is a character from Greek mythology, the setting would naturally be ancient Greece. Since the play is based on her story, it's likely set during the time when these myths were prominent, which is the ancient period, around 5th century BCE.

Putting this together, the timeframe starts and ends with the ancient period. The location is Athens, as that's where Ariane's story originates from.
</think>
